details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rallye Monte-Carlo

Date: January 24–27, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Monte Carlo, Monaco

Total Distance: Approx. 1,495 km (competitive stages ~323 km)

Variable mountain weather once again made tire choice the ultimate gamble, with dry asphalt often giving way to ice within the same stage.

🗺️ Route Details

Key stages included:

  • La Bréole–Selonnet: High-altitude tarmac with unpredictable ice patches.
  • Agnières-en-Dévoluy–Corps: Fast sections broken up by technical hairpins.
  • Col de Turini: The rally’s iconic night stage with walls of snow.

Crews faced constant risk-reward decisions on tire compound selection.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

2nd Place: Thierry Neuville & Nicolas Gilsoul (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

3rd Place: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

Ogier secured his sixth consecutive Monte win, mastering the mixed conditions with calm precision.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Citroën C3 WRC: Strong mechanical grip and responsive handling.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Stable and adaptable to changing surfaces.
  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Showed dominant pace in dry conditions.

Monte Carlo 2019 proved that driver adaptability is as important as raw speed.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Rapid Surface Changes: Asphalt to snow to ice in minutes.
  • Tire Strategy: Balancing grip and wear across long loops.
  • Night Stages: Reduced visibility on narrow, twisting mountain roads.

The 2019 edition was a mental chess match on wheels, with weather dictating every move.

title: 2019 Rally Sweden (Sweden)
bio: The only full-snow rally on the WRC calendar, Rally Sweden delivered high-speed action on frozen forest roads lined with snowbanks, where commitment and precise car placement were key.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Sweden

Date: February 14–17, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Torsby, Sweden

Total Distance: Approx. 1,464 km (competitive stages ~316 km)

Snowbanks became the ultimate safety net and danger zone, allowing drivers to lean on them in corners but punishing those who misjudged their entry.

🗺️ Route Details

Memorable stages included:

  • Hof-Finnskog: High-speed forests with big jumps.
  • Vargåsen: Home to the iconic Colin's Crest jump, where distance records are chased.
  • Likenäs: Tight, twisty sections that demand precision on ice.

Studded tires provided immense grip, but warmer weather risked exposing gravel in some sections.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

2nd Place: Esapekka Lappi & Janne Ferm (Citroën C3 WRC)

3rd Place: Thierry Neuville & Nicolas Gilsoul (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

Tänak’s victory propelled him into the championship lead with a measured yet aggressive drive.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Exceptional traction and stability on snow.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Strong in tight, technical frozen stages.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Consistent pace across varying snow conditions.

The 2019 edition rewarded precise pacenotes and an unflinching right foot.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Changing Snow Conditions: Ice melting into gravel reduced stud life.
  • High Speeds: Demanded extreme confidence in pacenotes.
  • Snowbank Traps: One miscalculation could end the rally.

Rally Sweden 2019 proved why winter rallies remain a thrilling spectacle in modern WRC.

title: 2019 Rally Guanajuato México (Mexico)
bio: WRC’s annual trip to Mexico brought the first gravel challenge of the season, with intense heat, rough mountain stages, and high-altitude conditions that sapped engine performance.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Guanajuato México

Date: March 7–10, 2019

Start/Finish Location: León, Mexico

Total Distance: Approx. 1,000 km (competitive stages ~316 km)

The rally kicked off with a vibrant ceremonial start in the historic silver-mining city of Guanajuato before moving into the dusty mountain roads of Sierra de Lobos and Sierra de Guanajuato.

🗺️ Route Details

Key stages included:

  • El Chocolate: Long climbs and descents with loose gravel.
  • Otates: Rough, technical sections that test suspension durability.
  • Las Minas: High-altitude roads lined with unforgiving rock faces.

Thin air at over 2,700 meters above sea level reduced engine output by up to 20%.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

2nd Place: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

3rd Place: Elfyn Evans & Scott Martin (Ford Fiesta WRC)

Ogier’s controlled pace and tire management proved decisive in the grueling heat.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Citroën C3 WRC: Adaptable suspension and reliable cooling systems.
  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Maintained strong pace in thin air.
  • Ford Fiesta WRC: Robust and stable on rough surfaces.

Success here was all about balancing aggression with preservation.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • High Altitude: Impacted both power and braking efficiency.
  • Heat Management: Essential to avoid overheating engines and brakes.
  • Loose Gravel: Made traction unpredictable.

Rally México 2019 was a brutal test of endurance, rewarding teams with meticulous preparation.

title: 2019 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: The ‘Rally of 10,000 Corners’ returned with its famously twisty tarmac stages along the stunning coastline and through the mountains of Corsica, demanding relentless precision from drivers.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Tour de Corse

Date: March 28–31, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Bastia, Corsica, France

Total Distance: Approx. 1,175 km (competitive stages ~347 km)

Corsica’s tarmac roads offered no room for error, with steep drop-offs, rock faces, and endless hairpins testing the stamina of drivers and co-drivers alike.

🗺️ Route Details

Key stages included:

  • Bavella: Mountain passes with sweeping views and constant cornering.
  • Castagniccia: Narrow roads flanked by stone walls and villages.
  • SS Power Stage: A sprint along cliffside roads to the finish.

Every kilometer brought relentless changes in rhythm, forcing total concentration.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Thierry Neuville & Nicolas Gilsoul (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

2nd Place: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

3rd Place: Elfyn Evans & Scott Martin (Ford Fiesta WRC)

Evans heartbreakingly lost the win in the final stage after a puncture, handing victory to Neuville.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Excellent stability and braking consistency.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Strong mid-corner grip on Corsican asphalt.
  • Ford Fiesta WRC: Competitive pace throughout, marred by late misfortune.

Tour de Corse 2019 was a showcase of precision rallying at its finest.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Corner Volume: Over 10,000 bends tested co-driver rhythm.
  • Narrow Roads: No margin for mistakes.
  • Surface Changes: Grip variations between shaded and sunny sections.

The 2019 Tour de Corse demanded relentless focus from start to finish.

title: 2019 Rally Argentina (Argentina)
bio: One of the roughest rallies on the calendar, Rally Argentina featured river crossings, rocky mountain passes, and passionate fans crowding the stages in huge numbers.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Argentina

Date: April 25–28, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Villa Carlos Paz, Argentina

Total Distance: Approx. 1,300 km (competitive stages ~347 km)

Famed for its rutted gravel, spectacular water splashes, and iconic mountainous backdrops, Rally Argentina once again delivered drama and excitement.

🗺️ Route Details

Standout stages included:

  • El Condor: High-altitude, rocky climbs lined with huge crowds.
  • Mina Clavero: Narrow mountain tracks with water crossings.
  • Santa Rosa – San Agustin: Fast-flowing gravel with big jumps.

Weather varied from sunny dust bowls to heavy rain, drastically changing grip levels.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Thierry Neuville & Nicolas Gilsoul (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

2nd Place: Andreas Mikkelsen & Anders Jæger (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

3rd Place: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

Hyundai scored a dominant 1–2 finish with strong pace and durability on rough gravel.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Durable and quick over rugged terrain.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Strong in technical sections, struggled on long straights.
  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Flashes of speed but marred by mechanical issues.

The event rewarded cars with robust suspension and engines able to withstand punishing stages.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Water Crossings: Risked engine stalls and damage.
  • Rocky Terrain: Punctures were common and costly.
  • Fan Presence: Narrow passages lined with thousands of spectators added to the pressure.

Rally Argentina 2019 delivered thrills and a bruising test of man and machine.

title: 2019 Rally Chile (Chile)
bio: Making its debut on the WRC calendar, Rally Chile brought fast-flowing forest roads, sweeping coastal views, and a brand-new challenge for drivers and teams.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Chile

Date: May 9–12, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Concepción, Chile

Total Distance: Approx. 1,250 km (competitive stages ~325 km)

This inaugural South American round impressed with smooth, high-speed gravel stages set among eucalyptus forests, combined with fog and coastal winds that kept drivers on their toes.

🗺️ Route Details

Highlights included:

  • El Puma: Wide gravel roads with sweeping bends through dense woodland.
  • Bio Bio River Stages: Open, flowing sections with long sightlines.
  • Power Stage: Coastal roads where wind and mist altered visibility and grip.

Chile’s stages were praised for their smooth surfaces but punished over-commitment with minimal margin for error.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

2nd Place: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

3rd Place: Sébastien Loeb & Daniel Elena (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

Tänak’s victory showcased Toyota’s gravel pace, while Loeb returned to the podium in spectacular fashion.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Balanced handling and top-speed advantage.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Strong traction on technical sections.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Loeb extracted maximum pace with veteran precision.

Teams adapted quickly to new pacenote demands and unfamiliar grip conditions.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Fog and Low Visibility: Several morning stages demanded ultra-precise pacenotes.
  • New Terrain: No prior WRC experience on these roads meant equal learning curves.
  • Fast Commitment: High-speed corners required full trust in co-driver calls.

The 2019 Rally Chile marked an exciting new chapter for the championship.

title: 2019 Rally de Portugal (Portugal)
bio: One of the most popular rallies on the calendar, Rally de Portugal delivered fast gravel roads, huge spectator turnout, and the famous Fafe jump finale.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally de Portugal

Date: May 30 – June 2, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Matosinhos, Portugal

Total Distance: Approx. 1,450 km (competitive stages ~311 km)

Rally Portugal’s blend of fast, dusty gravel stages and massive fan atmosphere once again delivered thrilling competition.

🗺️ Route Details

Key stages:

  • Fafe: Legendary jump and packed spectator banks.
  • Amarante: Longest stage of the rally with changing gravel and rocky patches.
  • Vieira do Minho: Technical climbs and descents with loose gravel.

Loose surface on the first pass became rutted by the second, demanding suspension resilience.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

2nd Place: Thierry Neuville & Nicolas Gilsoul (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

3rd Place: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

Tänak’s back-to-back win tightened the title fight, while Neuville recovered strongly after Chile.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Consistently fast on fast gravel stages.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Competitive pace, especially in tighter sections.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Held strong in rougher sections with steady grip.

Suspension strength was critical to surviving Portugal’s rocky stretches without damage.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Dust Clouds: Hanging dust reduced visibility for chasing crews.
  • Ruts and Rocks: Second passes became tire-punishing.
  • Fan Density: Massive crowds added to the rally’s electric atmosphere.

Portugal 2019 was a fan-favorite round and a true test of gravel endurance.

title: 2019 Rally Italia Sardegna (Italy)
bio: The narrow, sunbaked gravel roads of Sardinia once again delivered high drama, with a nail-biting finish that came down to the very last stage.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Italia Sardegna

Date: June 13–16, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Alghero, Sardinia, Italy

Total Distance: Approx. 1,400 km (competitive stages ~310 km)

Sardinia’s twisty gravel roads, lined with rocks and trees, punished even the smallest mistake and rewarded precise, disciplined driving.

🗺️ Route Details

Iconic stages included:

  • Monte Lerno: Featuring the famous "Micky’s Jump" and brutal rocky climbs.
  • Coiluna–Loelle: Narrow, technical sections with limited passing opportunities.
  • Power Stage Sassari–Argentiera: Coastal gravel with high-speed blasts and scenic cliffside views.

Dry, dusty conditions amplified the difficulty, with hanging dust clouds affecting visibility for trailing crews.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Dani Sordo & Carlos del Barrio (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

2nd Place: Teemu Suninen & Jarmo Lehtinen (Ford Fiesta WRC)

3rd Place: Andreas Mikkelsen & Anders Jæger-Amland (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

Sordo claimed a dramatic victory by just 1.5 seconds after Ott Tänak suffered a power steering failure on the final stage.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Strong in tight, twisty sections with great traction.
  • Ford Fiesta WRC: Agile and quick on technical gravel.
  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Dominant before mechanical heartbreak.

Cars needed excellent cooling and durability to survive Sardinia’s relentless terrain.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Rocky Roads: Tire and suspension management were critical.
  • Dust Clouds: Hampered visibility for following crews.
  • Heat Management: High temperatures pushed cooling systems to their limits.

Sardinia 2019 proved that in rallying, anything can happen until the final corner.

title: 2019 Rally Finland (Finland)
bio: Known as the 'Grand Prix of Rallying,' Rally Finland once again delivered blisteringly fast gravel stages, massive jumps, and breathtaking commitment from the drivers.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Finland

Date: August 1–4, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Jyväskylä, Finland

Total Distance: Approx. 1,400 km (competitive stages ~307 km)

Rally Finland’s high-speed gravel roads and famous jumps showcased pure rally performance, with minimal margin for error at top speeds.

🗺️ Route Details

Fan-favorite stages included:

  • Ouninpohja: Legendary jumps and flat-out crests.
  • Päijälä: Fast forest roads demanding precision.
  • Ruuhimäki Power Stage: A high-flying finale featuring massive airtime.

Gravel surfaces were smooth and fast, with grip increasing dramatically on the second pass.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

2nd Place: Esapekka Lappi & Janne Ferm (Citroën C3 WRC)

3rd Place: Jari-Matti Latvala & Miikka Anttila (Toyota Yaris WRC)

Tänak’s commanding performance tightened his grip on the championship lead.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Perfectly suited for Finland’s high-speed jumps and corners.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Stable and competitive in fast sections.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Struggled to match outright pace but remained consistent.

Suspension travel and stability were crucial for surviving Finland’s flat-out crests.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • High-Speed Pacenotes: Required razor-sharp timing between driver and co-driver.
  • Jump Landings: Harsh impacts tested suspension strength.
  • Maintaining Momentum: Any lift off the throttle cost valuable seconds.

Finland 2019 was a masterclass in precision, bravery, and speed.

title: 2019 Rallye Deutschland (Germany)
bio: Germany’s WRC round delivered its signature mix of military asphalt, vineyard hairpins, and unpredictable weather, putting both driver skill and tire strategy to the ultimate test.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rallye Deutschland

Date: August 22–25, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Bostalsee, Germany

Total Distance: Approx. 1,228 km (competitive stages ~344 km)

This rally’s unique blend of tarmac conditions made it one of the most technically challenging asphalt rounds in the WRC calendar.

🗺️ Route Details

Three distinct terrains tested drivers:

  • Mosel Vineyards: Tight hairpins, steep gradients, and slippery surfaces from gravel drag.
  • Baumholder Military Area: Harsh concrete, sharp stones, and infamous hinkelsteins (massive concrete blocks).
  • Saarland Country Roads: Fast-flowing asphalt with blind crests.

Mixed conditions meant tire choice often made or broke a stage result.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

2nd Place: Kris Meeke & Seb Marshall (Toyota Yaris WRC)

3rd Place: Jari-Matti Latvala & Miikka Anttila (Toyota Yaris WRC)

A Toyota 1-2-3 showcased the team’s tarmac dominance and Tänak’s championship control.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Stable and predictable in changing grip levels.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Strong in vineyard sections but inconsistent in military area.
  • Ford Fiesta WRC: Agile but lacked ultimate pace.

Cars needed both agility for hairpins and strength for Baumholder’s punishing terrain.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Variable Grip: Rapid changes from tarmac to concrete to dirt dragged onto the road.
  • Weather Shifts: Sudden rain made stages treacherous.
  • Precision: Millimeter-perfect line choice around hinkelsteins was essential.

Germany 2019 was a calculated test of precision and discipline, rewarding those who balanced speed with risk management.

title: 2019 Rally Turkey (Turkey)
bio: One of the roughest events on the WRC calendar, Rally Turkey 2019 was a war of attrition where reliability mattered as much as speed.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Turkey

Date: September 12–15, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Marmaris, Turkey

Total Distance: Approx. 988 km (competitive stages ~310 km)

The hot, rocky gravel roads of Turkey pushed drivers, co-drivers, and machines to the edge with brutal attrition rates.

🗺️ Route Details

Stages combined scenic beauty with mechanical torture:

  • Datça Peninsula: Technical switchbacks and loose gravel perched above turquoise waters.
  • Çetibeli: Narrow, rocky passes punishing tires and suspension.
  • Marmaris Power Stage: A mix of coastal gravel and asphalt sections through the service park.

Temperatures soared, making cockpit heat management and hydration vital.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

2nd Place: Esapekka Lappi & Janne Ferm (Citroën C3 WRC)

3rd Place: Andreas Mikkelsen & Anders Jæger-Amland (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

Ogier capitalized on Tänak’s retirement to close the championship gap with a controlled and resilient drive.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Citroën C3 WRC: Balanced pace with tire conservation perfectly.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Strong on loose gravel, suffered with punctures.
  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Fast but mechanically vulnerable in rocky sections.

Survival required bulletproof durability and mechanical sympathy.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Rough Terrain: Constant threat of punctures and suspension damage.
  • Heat: Cockpit temperatures exceeded 50°C.
  • Fatigue: Long, punishing days tested concentration.

Rally Turkey 2019 was a brutal reminder that endurance can be as decisive as outright pace.

title: 2019 Wales Rally GB (United Kingdom)
bio: Wales Rally GB delivered its signature mix of rain, mud, and fog in 2019, providing one of the most authentic tests of rally skill on the calendar.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Wales Rally GB

Date: October 3–6, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Llandudno, Wales

Total Distance: Approx. 1,599 km (competitive stages ~309 km)

A classic of the WRC calendar, Wales Rally GB remained a treacherous, unpredictable event defined by tight forestry stages and relentless autumn weather.

🗺️ Route Details

The rally spanned North and Mid Wales:

  • Gwydir & Penmachno Forests: Narrow, muddy tracks with tree-lined blind corners.
  • Hafren & Sweet Lamb: Long, flowing gravel stretches with iconic water splashes and jumps.
  • Oulton Park: Spectator-friendly super special on mixed surfaces.

Early morning fog and constant drizzle made grip levels changeable and unpredictable.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

2nd Place: Thierry Neuville & Nicolas Gilsoul (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

3rd Place: Sébastien Ogier & Julien Ingrassia (Citroën C3 WRC)

Tänak’s victory brought him one step closer to securing his first WRC drivers' title.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Controlled power delivery and grip in slippery conditions.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Quick on flowing sections but lost time in deep mud.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Good mid-corner stability but lacked the same acceleration punch.

Cars needed precise suspension setups to handle the constantly evolving Welsh gravel.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Fog & Rain: Reduced visibility meant co-driver calls were critical.
  • Mud Build-up: Deep ruts made car placement tricky.
  • Long Days: Early starts and long loops tested endurance.

Wales Rally GB 2019 proved once again that wet-weather mastery is an art form in rallying.

title: 2019 Rally Catalunya – Rally de España (Spain)
bio: Spain’s mixed-surface event brought high-speed gravel and silky-smooth asphalt together for one of the most unique challenges in the WRC.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Catalunya – Rally de España

Date: October 24–27, 2019

Start/Finish Location: Salou, Spain

Total Distance: Approx. 1,289 km (competitive stages ~325 km)

The only mixed-surface rally in the WRC, Spain tested adaptability with its day-one gravel stages followed by two days of pure tarmac racing.

🗺️ Route Details

Stages offered distinct characteristics:

  • Gravel Opening Day: Fast and dusty with loose stones reducing grip.
  • Tarmac Stages: Smooth, circuit-like asphalt perfect for late braking and high-speed cornering.
  • Power Stage at Salou: Beachfront spectacle on mixed surfaces.

The switch from gravel to asphalt overnight demanded major suspension and brake setup changes.

🏆 Results

Overall Winner: Thierry Neuville & Nicolas Gilsoul (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

2nd Place: Ott Tänak & Martin Järveoja (Toyota Yaris WRC)

3rd Place: Dani Sordo & Carlos del Barrio (Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC)

Neuville kept his title hopes mathematically alive with a flawless performance on tarmac.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Excellent asphalt balance and braking stability.
  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Versatile across surfaces but lost time in early gravel stages.
  • Ford Fiesta WRC: Agile on twisty tarmac but inconsistent pace overall.

Cars required maximum adaptability with two completely different setup philosophies in one weekend.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Surface Transition: Teams had to nail overnight setup swaps.
  • Tire Management: Different compounds for gravel and tarmac days.
  • High-Speed Corners: Precision braking points critical to success.

Rally Catalunya 2019 was a showcase of adaptability, rewarding those who mastered two surfaces in one weekend.

title: 2019 Rally Australia (Australia)
bio: The 2019 Rally Australia was cancelled due to catastrophic bushfires in New South Wales, marking the first WRC event in history to be called off for safety reasons before it began.
details_html:
🏁 Overview

Event Name: 2019 Rally Australia

Date: Scheduled for November 14–17, 2019

Planned Start/Finish Location: Coffs Harbour, New South Wales

Total Planned Distance: Approx. 1,050 km (competitive stages ~324 km)

Severe bushfires across the New South Wales region forced the cancellation of the final round of the 2019 WRC season. Safety concerns for competitors, officials, and local communities made it impossible to proceed with the rally.

🗺️ Planned Route Details

The original route would have featured:

  • Coastal Gravel Stages: Fast, flowing tracks near Coffs Harbour with ocean views.
  • Forestry Sections: Technical routes through eucalyptus forests, combining dust and narrow lines.
  • Night Stage: A short spectator-friendly test under floodlights.

Due to the fire risk, all stages were abandoned and the event site became part of the firefighting and evacuation efforts.

🏆 Results

No competition was held, and no championship points were awarded for the event.

The cancellation confirmed Ott Tänak as the 2019 WRC Drivers’ Champion and Toyota Gazoo Racing as Manufacturers’ Champions.

🚗 Vehicle Highlights

  • Toyota Yaris WRC: Entered as the championship leader and favored for the mixed gravel stages.
  • Hyundai i20 Coupe WRC: Strong contender on loose surfaces with Neuville aiming for a final win.
  • Citroën C3 WRC: Set for its last WRC appearance before Citroën’s withdrawal.

The cars never took the start line, leaving their final 2019 setups unused.

🧭 Navigation and Challenges

  • Bushfire Risk: Fires rapidly spreading in proximity to stages.
  • Evacuations: Roads were prioritized for emergency vehicles and civilians.
  • Air Quality: Smoke reduced visibility and created hazardous breathing conditions.

The 2019 Rally Australia became a sobering reminder that even motorsport must yield to greater safety concerns in times of crisis.
